From:

To: 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: RE: privilege review contact information 
cfl 
< 
I might just say that we intend to implement a privilege review of materials for which that would be appropriateâ€”for 
example, I believe that the FBI takes the view that photos do not need to be reviewed for privilege in the first instance. 
But otherwise sounds fine, and happy to discuss that further if useful. 
thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Wednesday, August 14, 2019 15:59 
To: 
> 
Subject: FW: RE: privilege review contact information 
Marty just reached out to me and wants to provide me with Epstein's list of counsel as long as I agree not to share it with 
the case team without his consent and that we implement a privilege review of the materials seized from Epstein. So 
unless you want to discuss, I plan to agree to the former and confirm the latter. I ran it by just to be safe. 
EFTA00013251

Thanks, 
From: 
Sent: Tuesday, August 13, 2019 4:58 PM 
To: 'Marty Weinberg' <marty@martinweinberglaw.com>; Miller, Michael .ic> 
Cc: ; Weingarten, Reid 
Subject: RE: privilege review contact information 
Marty, Mike, 
Following up on our conversation this afternoon via phone, I wanted to put you in touch directly with who 
is the Office's Privilege Review Logistic Coordinator. I know you have been interested in providing us with privilege-related 
information in connection with our review process; please feel free to contact Ms. directly to facilitate that. 
She is available at the email address copied here. 
thank you, 
Assistant U.S. Attorney 
Southern District of New York 
EFTA00013252
